title: How to Make Bratwurst and Gravy

steps.headline: Set 1 pot of water on high heat until boiling.
steps.description: Set 1 pot of water on medium heat.

steps.headline: Boil 2 bratwurst in water for 15 minutes.
Pour 2 tablespoons of olive oil into a large pan.
steps.description: Place bratwurst in pan and cook on medium heat until brown. While bratwurst is cooking, dice bell pepper.

steps.headline: Slice bratwurst lengthwise and brown the insides.
Remove bratwurst from heat and slice width wise into smaller pieces.
steps.description: Also, turn up heat on second pot and pour 4 cups of bowtie pasta into pot.

steps.headline: When bratwurst is finished, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to pan.
steps.description: Add diced pepper into pan on medium heat.

steps.headline: Add 1 teaspoon onion powder and 1 teaspoon mustard powder to pan.
steps.description: Cook mixture on medium heat until pepper is soft but not brown.

steps.headline: Mix 3 tablespoons flour and ½ teaspoon salt in a cup.
steps.description: Pour 1 cup chicken broth and 1 cup milk into flour/salt mixture.

steps.headline: Stir well until the flour is no longer clumped.
Add mixture into pan with pepper.
Cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until gravy thickens.
steps.description: Lower heat and add bratwurst pieces. Heat for 5 minutes on low.

steps.headline: Once pasta is soft, drain water.
steps.description: Serve bratwurst and gravy over pasta. Makes about 3 to 4 servings. DONE!

text: Set 1 pot of water on high heat until boiling. Set 1 pot of water on medium heat. Boil 2 bratwurst in water for 15 minutes.  Pour 2 tablespoons of olive oil into a large pan. Place bratwurst in pan and cook on medium heat until brown. While bratwurst is cooking, dice bell pepper. Slice bratwurst lengthwise and brown the insides.  Remove bratwurst from heat and slice width wise into smaller pieces. Also, turn up heat on second pot and pour 4 cups of bowtie pasta into pot. When bratwurst is finished, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil to pan. Add diced pepper into pan on medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon onion powder and 1 teaspoon mustard powder to pan. Cook mixture on medium heat until pepper is soft but not brown. Mix 3 tablespoons flour and ½ teaspoon salt in a cup. Pour 1 cup chicken broth and 1 cup milk into flour/salt mixture. Stir well until the flour is no longer clumped.  Add mixture into pan with pepper.  Cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until gravy thickens. Lower heat and add bratwurst pieces. Heat for 5 minutes on low. Once pasta is soft, drain water. Serve bratwurst and gravy over pasta. Makes about 3 to 4 servings. DONE!
